WorkItem.Description:
I am trying to include the map application in a project I am working on. I tried to use a GMapMarkerGoogleRed marker but it throws a TypeInitializationException when I use the same code shown in the Demo.WindowsForms

currentMarker = new GMapMarkerGoogleRed(MainMap.Position);

In the project I am using, if I simply add the DLL references i get a SimpletonCreator threw an exception and the tiles remain blue. If I include the Source Code then I get the exception.

For further testing, I removed the references in the Demo.WindowsForms and added the source code folders and once again I got the TypeInitializationException with the following error: 
"{"Could not find any resources appropriate for the specified culture or the neutral culture.  Make sure \"System.Windows.Forms.Properties.Resources.resources\" was correctly embedded or linked into assembly \"Demo.WindowsForms\" at compile time, or that all the satellite assemblies required are loadable and fully signed."}"

Comments.Message: That's what I meant...the two dlls. Sorry for posting here I meant to do it on discussion board. But I still have the same error.
